issue.title: Using sync with drive does not delete erased dirs in source from dest

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body: Using rclone-v1.17-linux-amd64 with google drive if I sync a folder with a sub-folder that contains a file and then delete the sub-folder from the source directory and sync again the file within the sub-folder is deleted but the empty directory remains in google drive. Maybe it is something I'm not doing right, anyway great job!

issue.title: Empty Folders

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Hi

Can you add an option to create empty folders

Regards

body:
I just noticed this issue when I sync to drive. I would definitely like to have folders deleted in addition to the contained files. 
Thanks a lot for the copy program, it's the most reliable I've used so far for google drive.
@mullenkamp thanks for the vote of confidence! I can see a plan coming together for this.
Been using Rclone regularly for the past few months. Works solid. There are a good number of empty directories left in my Dropbox. This would be awesome if it was built in with the sync command.

issue.title: Sync Method with Drive

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Hi

On source : D:\Test\A\1.pdf

First Time : I launch rclone with sync method => TEST\A\1.pdf was created on drive
Second Time : Deletion on source of the subfolder A containing the file 1.PDF
Third Time : I Launch rclone with Sync Method and nothing changes on Drive

The file was deleted but the subfolder stills present on Drive

Regards

issue.title: Yandex Disk storage backend

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Hi.
I've created [Yandex Disk](https://disk.yandex.com/) cloud storage backend for rclone.

Already working:
- rclone opetations: copy, sync, ls, lsl(size, md5, modificationTime)
- uploading/downloading/removing/listing files
- creating directories

I've tested syncronization and copying to and from the cloud a bit

Not working yet:
- lsd operation (will add later)
- empty folders not created/removed yet

Needed:
- no documentation yet
- not everything is covered with unit tests
- maybe api part need some refactoring

I will cleanup code and posting it a bit later.

If you're interested, I think you need to register oAuth app with Yandex Disk https://tech.yandex.com/oauth/  for rClone.

As of today I think Yandex Disk offering somwhere about 10Gb for free.

issue.title: rclone sync is not deleting directoriesit's only removing their contents. (Amazon Cloud Drive)

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
I had a local directory Disk/Audiobooks/Mistborn, inside of which are a bunch of mp3 files making up the book's various chapters. I then ran rclone sync Disk Amazon:Archive

Later, I deleted the Mistborn folder from my Audiobooks directory, and ran rclone sync again. Even though all of the mp3 files inside of the Mistborn folder get deleted, the directory itself does not go away.

This is just one example. Directories consistently seem to not get deletedonly their contents does.

Edit: My bad, I just realized this is expected behavior: https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/100

body:
This is specially important for synchronizing databases (for example, a git repo) which may:
1. require an empty directory to be there.
2. leave behind a large number of empty directories.

issue.title: Sync not deleting old files from remote drive

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Hello,

I am using the sync command straight, without any options, but I find older directories are not being deleted from the remote drive.  In other words, the remote is not an exact replica of the local.  For example, a renamed folder is there with both new name and old name, with all of the files inside both.

What am I missing?  I re-read the Read Me file, and if I understand it correctly, a straight sync command is what I should be using to keep the remote as an exact replica of the local.  

Thanks!

Isaiah

body:
Is there any chance that this will be prioritized in the near-ish future?

The longer that I use rclone to sync the contents of my local hard drive with ACD, the more of a problem this is becoming. As files naturally get reorganized and moved around, more and more empty folders pile up on ACD. An aesthetic problem, perhaps, but it's becoming difficult to actually find the files I want, and there's no way to programmatically find and delete the empty folders short of completely deleting the remote copy and re-uploading from scratch, which would take literal months over my internet connection.

Rclone is still useful for creating remote backups should my local hard drive fail, but it's a lot less useful than it once was.

issue.title: --dry-run creates folders

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Hi,
Found some odd behavior regarding folders with Google drive:

rclone version: v1.27
system: Ubuntu 14.04.3 LTS x86_64
#### Issue 1: --dry-run created a folder

The command `rclone --dry-run sync TestFolder/ gdrive:TestFolder`
created an empty `TestFolder` on my Google Drive. Here is the Drive Activity log:

```
You created an item in
rclone  4:49 PM
Google Drive Folder
My Drive
Google Drive Folder
TestFolder
```

But since this was a `--dry-run`, I expected only a **report** that `TestFolder` would be created.
#### Issue 2: empty folders not deleted after sync

After properly creating `TestFolder` and its hierarchy on Drive with 

```
rclone sync TestFolder/ gdrive:TestFolder
```

my Drive Activity log shows creation of files and the subfolder `test folder 2` (as expected):

```
You created an item in
rclone  5:02 PM
Google Drive Folder
TestFolder
Text
test.txt

You created an item in
rclone  5:02 PM
Google Drive Folder
test folder 2
Text
test2.txt

You created an item in
rclone  5:02 PM
Google Drive Folder
TestFolder
Google Drive Folder
test folder 2
```

But then I delete the contents of `TestFolder` on my local system:

```
cd TestFolder; rm -rf *
```

and resync with 

```
rclone sync TestFolder/ gdrive:TestFolder
```

I belive this should leave an empty `TestFolder` on my Drive, but the Activity log shows only:

```
You permanently deleted 2 items
rclone  5:11 PM
Text
test2.txt
Text
test.txt
```

and leaves behind the folder `test folder 2` even though it was deleted locally.

If if do: `rclone -v ls gdrive:TestFolder` I get:

```
2016/02/06 17:26:39 Google drive root 'TestFolder': Modify window is 1ms
2016/02/06 17:26:39 Google drive root 'TestFolder': Reading test folder 2/
2016/02/06 17:26:39 Google drive root 'TestFolder': Finished reading test folder 2/
2016/02/06 17:26:39 Google drive root 'TestFolder': Finished reading 
```

so rclone is seeing the left-behind empty folder `test folder 2`; this is verified also with lsd:

```
rclone lsd gdrive:TestFolder
-1 2016-02-06 22:02:16        -1 test folder 2
```

But I expected rclone to delete the empty folder `test folder 2`

I encountered this while syncing a number of local folders after some local changes. 

Let me know if I am missing something... 

But thanks for a great tool; better than other options!

body:
I think what I might do for this is just delete empty folders on the destination at the end of the sync.

This is relatively straight forward and will satisfy nearly all cases, except for that of syncing an empty directory.

issue.title: Refactor List/ListDir

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
WIP: DO NOT MERGE. Tests are expected to fail.

Concept proposal for #316

This shows the concept. All the heavy lifting is done in the "fs" package, making file system implementations a bit simpler.

/fs shows interfaces, and should compile.
/amazonclouddrive: Changed to new interface.
/b2: Changed to new interface.
/local: Changed to new interface.

The Fs no longer needs to create a separate goroutine when List/ListDir is called. Instead it can block as long as it likes. This simplifies implementations a bit (at least it doesn't become more complex).

Implementation is hidden in "fs" package, and only exposes the minimally needed interface, which of course can be extended.

body: I think it'll be a useful workaround. I'd go for a dedicated switch to enable the deletion so that people actually wanting empty folders will not be affected. BTW, great job: I synced almost 700GB in less that 3 days; I used to use rsync before and it kept crashing every few GBs. Excellent tool.

Sure adding a parameter to let user choose what he wants to do
- Delete empty folders or not delete
Deleting empty folders would definitely solve the problem for my use case.
I agree with @cento79: a switch to enable deletion would be a good solution. Started using rclone a few days ago. Good tool! Congrats!

issue.title: Exclude directories?

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
How does one exclude directories (and their subdirectories)? I am trying to sync some folders that include subversion and git controlled checkout projects. My filter file has the following, which excluded all the files but keeps all the folders. What is the correct way? 
- \.svn/**
- \.git/**

body: I definitely also vote for a switch to enable folder deletion.

I am for folder deletion but I would rather see rclone delete a folder when asked to rather than delete the contents of a directory and then the empty directory.  The reason that I have for this:

In my use case, I use Amazon Cloud Drive to store home camera data (videos/jpgs) from my home's automation.  I store everything in directories sort of like this:

/cams/<cameraname>/2016-02-01
/cams/<cameraname>/2016-02-02
/cams/<cameraname>/2016-02-03
/cams/<cameraname>/2016-02-04
/cams/<cameraname>/2016-02-05

etc.  So daily folders for each camera.  In the GUI, when I send a folder to the trash, it literally sends the folder to the trash and if I were to try to purge that folder or even restore that folder it would be VERY simply to do.  i.e. select the folder and restore/delete depending on my wishes.

IF I perform the deletes via RCLONE, It deletes and puts in the trash up with tens of thousands of individual files contained in those folders.  Good luck trying to restore them when they are all intermixed with different days/cameras. and there is no method available in amazon cloud drive to 'purge trash' (It needs to be done in batches of 1000 and takes a long time via the GUI).

It would be more efficient to have rclone delete the contents or folder depending on what you specify.  Like this:

This could delete individual files
rclone -delete robacd:/cams/playroom/2016-03-29/\* 
OR
rclone -delete robacd:/cams/playroom/2016-03-29/

This could delete the FOLDER itself (no trailing slash and/or no star)
rclone -delete robacd:/cams/playroom/2016-03-29

Thanks for the great tool.

Perhaps this should be split into two separate tickets? I think that properly managing folders is clearly the ideal long-term goal, but it would be great if rclone could simply delete empty folders in the interim.
